title: Is everything alright with this pc build?
body:
So basically I am about to buy my pc parts but I am unsure whether I selected the right parts. 
Are you able to check for me wether the chosen parts I've chosen is great for my needs/conditions? I'm basically wanting to do gaming and editing/rendering with videos and 3d and animation following with Photoshop. On top of that I want to record my using without any stuttering/fps drops.


Here are my chosen PC Parts:

• Intel Kaby Lake Core i7 7700 CPU 

• Cooler Master - Hyper 212X 82.9 CFM CPU Cooler 

• Gigabyte Sniper B8 Motherboard 

• Kingston - Savage 16GB (2 x 8GB) DDR4-2400 Memory 

• 240GB SanDisk SSD Ultra II 2.5" Drive 

• Seagate - Barracuda 2TB 3.5" 7200RPM Internal Hard Drive 

• Gigabyte GeForce GTX 1070 8GB OC Gaming Graphics Card 

• EVGA - SuperNOVA G2 750W 80+ Gold Certified Fully-Modular ATX Power Supply 

• Microsoft - Windows 10 Home OEM 64-bit 

• Gigabyte - GC-WB867D-I PCI-Express x1 802.11a/b/g/n/ac Wi-Fi Adapter 

• AOC - G2460VQ6 24.0" 1920x1080 75Hz Monitor

replies.body: if you're gonna get all that might as well put a fkn 1080 ti in it

lol this beast will sit at roughly 200+ fps
The only problem you should worry is your internet connection lol

> [{quoted}](name=Kalista Bang,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=BGF8cTYX,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2017-10-20T04:23:51.169+0000)
>
> lol this beast will sit at roughly 200+ fps
> The only problem you should worry is your internet connection lol

My PC is six years old and I sit on 220 FPS. Put your e-peen away and limit FPS like a normal human being.

Intel Kaby Lake Core i7 7700 CPU
Go for the 7700k, A) It's better value for money, B) it's leaves the option to tweak clock settings open, C) they're better quality prints of the same chip.

ASUS PRIME B250M-A Motherboard
This build is so nice that I literally did a double take at this board; EVERYTHING in your build depends on the motherboard, don't cheap out on it. If you want a B series to save a few dollars that's fine, but go for something like the Asus ROG Strix B250H - on top of just being better components, it features an Intel I219V Lan chip (which is better than the realtek chip on the PRIME), 2 * 10 GBp/s USB 3.1 ports instead of 5GBp/s USB 3.0 ports (though you DO lose the USB-C port; honestly it's not a standard anyway; so unless you have a device and cable already I really wouldn't be bothered).
HOWEVER - IMPORTANT - If you decide to follow my above advice and go for a 7700k you basically NEED a z270 series board, as the unlocked clock timing isn't adjustable on anything else (it will run - I think, I haven't tried - you're literally losing functionality though); the good news is they have higher build quality in the base level boards, and more features - the bad is they will cost ~ 20-40 more.

Gigabyte Bluetooth 4.0 + AC Wifi PCI-E Network Card
WiFi is great - please don't ranked on it.

500W Be Quiet! Pure Power 10
... Right, here's the thing - I'm a touch old school, I've seen, helped, and yes owned, PCs with PSUs this small and they simply do not function well, the power drain in games is higher than it can output; bare minimum I would recommend a 600, preferably 700W. Great brand though, heard fantastic things about them. Again, I haven't had this issue in several years (because I run a friggin 800W platinum standard PSU), and power consumption has dropped... but I really, really strongly recommend at least 600W.

On the topic of Windows 10 Home 64-Bit:
Just quietly, Windows doesn't stop you using their system if you haven't paid for it. No seriously, it's fine - 100% functional and efficient. There's a shitty watermark on the desktop (and I think the background is locked? I dunno, haven't changed mine in a couple of years). 100% do NOT use an activator, and while I'm not advocating piracy, the Windows installer is a free download from the Microsoft site, make a bootable USB (using MS' tool, again, their website - NEVER a third party or torrent, nor your mate who "totally knows what he's doing and says it's fine" - we've all got one) and install it. I haven't done this in about a year and a half, so test it on a partition on your current PC before you commit and have no money left - but I haven't heard that it's changed (I own a legit copy myself). I'm not saying steal it, I'm saying if you need to save a few dollars, confirm this, then delay the purchase until later when you have the money :)

Thanks so much for your helpful reply. Means a lot. I've sent you a friend request for some advice and help haha. You can delete me after if you want xD.
